title.narrative: Ministry of Economy and Trade support

description.narrative: Support the fulfillment of economic growth, trade enhancement, internal markets development. Upgrading the Ministry’s economic policy analysis, public services, legislative capacities, and promoting good governance.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

description.narrative: Productive sectors strengthened to promote inclusive growth and local development especially in most disadvantaged areas

comment.narrative: Progress status by 2016; Reports in the framework of the LCRP; already negotiated and signed trade agreements; established Enterprise unit; SMEs strategy (2014)

. Sectoral policies developed . Business environment and country ranking improved . Trade negotiation mechanisms established and imporved . A functional export promotion agency established . Legislative agenda updated . Training equally male and female administrators . Support to the development of the private sector . Women SMEs encouraged specifically in poor areas, engaged SMEs through the development of the internal markets and the exports potential including women and vulnerable groups . IT needs assessed and strategy developed and implemented

- Developed lists of laws and regulations of concern to MOET and the improvement of the business environment, - Developed a comparison table of the ministerial statement versus the reform paper of the previous government, summary tables containing of needed laws and high level appointments, - Developed a brief concept note to the development of a national export strategy - Initiated a revision of the various initiatives proposed in the Lebanon Economic Vision to propose amendments in light of the crisis - Mapped the latest version of “What’s in Lebanon for SMEs” and proposing an update online

. Sectoral policies developed . Business environment and country ranking improved . Trade negotiation mechanisms established and imporved . A functional export promotion agency established . Legislative agenda updated . Training equally male and female administrators . Support to the development of the private sector . Women SMEs encouraged specifically in poor areas, engaged SMEs through the development of the internal markets and the exports potential including women and vulnerable groups . IT needs assessed and strategy developed and implemented . Transfer of technical and human resources to administration achieved

. Coordinating with the IFC - World Bank to develop and update the Lebanese SME strategy taking into consideration the Lebanese Economic Vision’s recommendations by McKinsey. . Increased ministry website and portal application security by implementing new SSL certificate . Managing and updating the SME sub portal on the Ministry’s website . Launched a campaign to promote Business Development Services in Lebanon to Donors and Partners alike . Prepared Lebanon comments on Kimberley UN resolution (rough diamond trade)

- Sectoral policies developed - Business environment and country ranking improved - Trade negotiation mechanisms established and improved - A functional Export Promotion Agency established - Legislative agenda updated - Training equally male and female administrators - Support to the development of the private sector - Women MSME encouraged specifically in poor areas - Engaged SMEs through the development of the internal markets and the export potentials including women and vulnerable groups - IT needs assessed and strategy developed and implemented - Transfer of technical and human resources to administration achieved

The below are the results achieved during the 1st quarter of 2018, and under the 4 projects outputs:
Output 1: The capacities of MOET to implement trade and economic policies improved Provided technical support for the development of the economic vision of Lebanon for the 5 upcoming years Updated the Economic Database on a weekly basis Updated all the Annual and Monthly Trade Statistics (Trade Partners, Top Import/Export Products) Conducted studies on several topics such as Family owned businesses, Greece-Lebanon Economic Cooperation, Council for Export Guarantees, Intellectual Property Rights in Lebanon among others Coordinated and reviewed the EU study on “Assessment of the competitiveness of services in Lebanon and the impact of World Trade Organization (WTO) accession. Researched, reviewed and completed a statistical briefing for the Relaxation of Rules of Origin as per Lebanon’s trade interest Conducted a study of the impact of the devaluation of the Turkish Lira/Egyptian Pound on Lebanon’s trade with Turkey and Egypt, respectively Conducted studies on the exemptions of complex products imported from non-EU countries, on excise duty for imported alcohol, particularly from EU markets, and on Brexit process and impact on Lebanon’s trade with the United Kingdom Led the Trade Remedies Unit at the Ministry of Economy and Trade on handling and analyzing petitions received from the Association of Industrialists on 26 sectors/industries Led the anti-Dumping investigation initiated on Aluminum facing the unfair competition from imported products from UAE, KSA, China and Egypt Led the preliminary investigations on Ducks and Corn flakes anti-Dumping initiated on facing the unfair competition from imported products (preparing and sending notifications to countries and questionnaires to importers, exporters and producers) Created a comprehensive and a consolidated overview of Lebanon’s existing and potential free trade agreements Monitored consumer protection reports and revised the inspectors’ Data Sampling on Food Safety on daily basis Provided Policy Advice on Protection of National Production to the Director General of Economy and Trade and the Investigating Authority ( DG Industry, DG Agriculture, and DG Customs) Provided consultation to the Private sector on the tools to be used to protect their industry from imported products Prepared Minister’s decisions on the initiation of the Investigations on protecting the Aluminum Profiles from Anti-Dumping practices from KSA, UAE, Egypt, China Co-Drafted, commented, revised : SME national definition, MOU’s , copyright paper, Kimberley UN resolution Drafted law aiming to abolish Exemption of Lebanese export profits from tax Participated in the Amendment of the Consumer Protection law Modernized the Code de commerce including SAL, SARL, Sole Partnership, Preferred Shares, GDR, Merger and Acquisition, Gender Equality in Bankruptcy issues…, Parliamentarian committees Organized the Lebanese first National SME Forum 2017 “Your needs , our challenges”. Coordinated the signing of MoU between MoET and the Global Compact Network Lebanon for upholding SDGs in MoET’s work Participated in the Gender Sensitive Communication seminar organized by UNDP Country Office and the Workshop on SDGs on gender equality (mainly SDG 5) organized by WMA and ESCWA. Delivering training on Women Entrepreneurship organized by Smart Line foundation with the support of UNDP Country Office Exploring the set-up of a program to support entrepreneurship amongst women and youth, in collaboration with the World Bank Launched a trial service that makes online training courses available to SMEs Output 2: Small and Medium enterprises (SME) Guidelines promoted, and private-public cooperation pursued Coordinated the signing of a MoU between MoET and Zoodel to support export activities of SMEs Developing a strategy about Women Empowerment in the economy as an extension of the National SME Strategy Working with the World Bank on the setup of an entrepreneurship fund with special focus on women and youth and of a Value Chain matching grant program Actively contributed to the draft text of the SME Definition law being prepared by MoET Working with the World Bank on the setup of the National Job Creation Program which is supposed to cover the establishment of the SME Observatory Introduced major updates to the SME section on MoET’s website in both English and Arabic Worked on the release of a new version in English and Arabic of the guidebook What’s in Lebanon for SMEs Output 3: MoET high impact delivery capacity for efficient public sector services institutionalised, partnerships developed, and transfer of skills to the administration enhanced
Data migration of Oracle Legacy Database & Current Back Office SQL Database to the SQL transition database with IPAS Integrating the current payment module with IPAS platform Implementation of the Backup solution project Create Companies Application for management and reports at Companies department in Trade Create Evaluation and Statistics Report Application form Completed modifications on the boycott application for the Boycott department Launched the new website with new features and new platform Replacing the digital telephony system to IP telephony system ( Cisco) at the ministry Head quarter and the regional offices Provided on the Job Training, and transfer of knowledge to the Trade Remedies Unit at the Ministry and to the experts assisting the Director General Provided on the job training for the public staff working on the development of software for the IPR and consumer Protection departments Output 4:Instruments to mitigate the impact of the Syrian Crisis on National economy developedParticipated in the planning of LCRP 2018
